intro: Pabstiella ribeironensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star moss, is a rare and specialized liverwort species native to the humid tropical regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its intricate, star-shaped thalloid structure. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in dense forests or on rocky substrates. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
